src:
Rokada na ATP tronu: Može biti samo 1!
Svi mogući scenariji povratka Đokovića posle samo dve sedmice danas započete vladavine Rafela Nadala

04 Nov 2019

Nakon 53 uzastopne sedmice neugrožene vladavine na ATP listi, došao je kraj. Umesto Novaka Đokovića, koji je jučerašnjim trijumfom u Parizu kompletirao ukupno 275 nedelja zaposedanja vrha svetske lestvice došao je red na povratak onoga kojeg je i skinuo, Rafaela Nadala. Dva grend slem trofeja i dominacija tokom sezone na šljaci, ali i slabo izdanje našeg asa na mnogim mastersima, doveli su do rokade nakon više od godinu dana. Zasluženo. I ponovo je na vrhu neko iz "velike trojke" i ponovo samo neko od njih može da skine Rafu. Dominacija se nastavlja.
Na najnovijoj listi u Top 10 je osim pomenute promene na vrhu došlo do još nekoliko pomeranja, pa je Stefanos Cicipas preskočio Aleksandera Zvereva na šestom mestu, dok su Mateo Beretini i Roberto Bautista Agut iskoristili oštar pad Karena Hačanova koji nije bio ni blizu odbrane krune u Parizu. Takođe, tu je i povratak iskusnog Gaela Monfisa u Top 10.
Što se tiče ostalih naših tenisera iz prvih 100, Dušan Lajović i Filip Krajnović su takođe pali za po jedno mesto te su sada 35, odnosno 40, Miomir Kecmanović je izgubio pet pozicija i drži 60, dok je jedino Laslo Đere mirovao na broju 38.
No, vratimo se na glavnu temu, a to su scenariji eventualnog povratka našeg asa na prvo mesto tokom završnog mastersa u Londonu koji počinje za sedam dana. Velika stvar je u pitanju pošto bi u tom slučaju Srbinu to pošlo šesti put u karijeri za rukom čime bi se izjednačio sa vodećim u toj kategoriji, Pitom Samprasom, a Nadalu peti.



Kao uostalom i Rafi. Ali, ne treba zaboraviti da su betonski tereni u zatvorenom rak-rana Matadoru sa Majorke koji u takvim uslovima ima samo jedan trofej i to osvojen na početku karijere. Takođe, nikada nije osvojio ovaj predstojeći, u Londonu. S druge strane, Beograđanin upravo najviše voli da igra na njima, što je dokazao i sinoć 77. ATP titulom (18. bez izgubljenog seta).
Na početku odmah da naglasimo da je završni masters poseban turnir na kojem učestvuje osam najboljih igrača u kalendarskoj godini koji se dele u dve grupe, a najbolja dva iz grupa idu u polufinale. Za svaku pobedu u početnoj fazi takmičenja dobija se po 200 poena, što znači da se odatle nosi najviše 600. Plasman u finale donosi još 400 poena, a još 500 se daje za titulu, te ako je šampion neporažen iz prestonice Velike Britanije može da odnese čak 1.500 ATP poena.
Povreda trbušnog zida koju je Nadal zaradio zagrevajući se u subotu mogla bi čak da ga spreči da igra u O2 hali, ali i u tom slučaju Španac bi mogao da ostane na prvom mestu, naravno, ako Đoković ne uspe da osvoji više od 640 poena. Dakle, da bi izbegao takav scenario morao bi da uzme makar dve pobede u grupi i plasman u finale.
Ukoliko Nadal igra, što i treba očekivati, to menja situaciju, jer njemu završava posao proboj do finala uz tri pobede u grupi, ili dve pobede u grupi i titula. Posebno uzbudljivo bi moglo biti kao bi Nadal ušao u finale sa dve pobede u grupi, a Đoković sa tri, te bi tako u međusobnom obračunu odlučili o najboljem. Takav scenario je viđeN 2016. kada je Endi Mari titulo u Londonu preuzeo u poslednjem trenutku prvo mesto on Noleta.
E, to je finale kojem se treba nadati.
ATP Top 10: 1. Rafael NADAL (Španija) 9.585 poena, 2. Novak ĐOKOVIĆ (Srbija) 8.945 3. Rodžer FEDERER (Švajcarska) 6.190, 4. Danil MEDVEDEV (Rusija) 5.705, 5. Dominik TIM (Austrija) 5.025, 6. Stefanos Cicipas (Grčka) 4.000, 7. Aleksander ZVEREV (Nemačka) 2.945, 8. Mateo Beretini (Italija) 2.670, 9. Roberto Bautista AGUT (Španija) 2.540, 10. Gael Monfis (Francuska) 2.530.
Srbi u Top 100: 1. ĐOKOVIĆ 9.545, 35. Dušan LAJOVIĆ 1.296, 38. Laslo ĐERE 1.171, 40. Filip KRAJINOVIĆ 1.148, 60. Miomir KECMANOVIĆ 901.
ATP Trka: 1. Nadal 9.585, 2. Đoković 8.945, 3. Federer 6.190, 4. Medvedev 5.705, 5. Tim 5.025, 6. Cicipas 4.000, 7. Zverev 2.945, 8. Mateo Beretini (Italija) 2.670...
ATP NextGen: 1. Cicipas 3.910, 2. Aleks de Minor (Australija) 1.730, 3. Feliks Ože Alijasim (Kanada) 1.636, 4. Denis Šapovalov (Kanada) 1.495, 5. Franses Tijafo (SAD) 1.060, 6. Ugo Imber (Francuska) 932, 7. Kasper Rud (Norveška) 931, 8. Miomir KECMANOVIĆ (Srbija) 901...

(Foto: Reuters)
text:
ATP Throne Casting: Only 1 Can Be!
All possible scenarios for Djokovic's return after just two weeks of the start of Rafael Nadal's reign today

04 Nov 2019

After 53 consecutive weeks of undefeated rule on the ATP list, the end has come. Instead of Novak Djokovic, who completed yesterday's triumph in Paris with a total of 275 weeks of occupying the top of the world ladder, it was his turn to return the one he took down, Rafael Nadal. Two grand slam trophies and dominance during the slag season, as well as a poor release of our ace by many masters, led to a rock-up after more than a year. Well deserved. And again, the top three are on top and only one of them can take down Rafa again. Dominance continues.
In addition to the aforementioned change in the top 10, the top 10 also made a few changes, with Stefanos Cicipas skipping Alexander Zverev in sixth place, while Mateo Beretini and Roberto Bautista Agut took advantage of Karen Hachanov's sharp fall, which was nowhere near the crown defense in Paris. Also, there is the return of the experienced Gael Monfis in the Top 10.
As for our other top 100 players, Dusan Lajovic and Filip Krajnovic also fell one place each and are now 35 and 40 respectively, Miomir Kecmanovic has lost five positions and holds 60, while only Laszlo Gyre is at 38.
But back to the main topic, these are scenarios of the eventual return of our ace to first place during the final Masters in London, which starts in seven days. The big deal is that, in that case, it would be the Serb for the sixth time in his career, equaling the leader in that category, Pete Sampras, and Nadal the fifth.



Like Rafi, after all. But it should not be forgotten that the concrete grounds are in the closed crayfish Matador from Mallorca, which in such conditions has only one trophy won at the beginning of his career. He also never won this upcoming one, in London. On the other hand, the Belgrader just loves playing on them, as he proved last night with his 77th ATP title (18th without a lost set).
At the outset, let us emphasize that the final masters is a special tournament in which the eight best players in a calendar year take part in two groups and the best two from the group go to the semifinals. For each victory in the initial phase of the competition, you get 200 points, which means that it carries a maximum of 600. Placing in the finals brings another 400 points and 500 more for the title, and if the champion is undefeated from the UK capital can take away as much as 1,500 ATP points.
The injury to the abdominal wall that Nadal earned by warming up on Saturday could even prevent him from playing in the O2 Hall, but in that case, the Spaniard could stay in the top spot, of course, if Djokovic fails to score more than 640 points. So, to avoid such a scenario, he would have to take at least two group wins and a final.
If Nadal plays, which is to be expected, it changes the situation, as he completes his work breakthrough to the finals with three group wins, or two group wins and a title. It could be especially exciting as Nadal enters the finals with two group victories and Djokovic with three, thus deciding on the best of each other. Such a scenario was seen in 2016 when Andy Marie took the Noleta first place title at the last minute in London.
Well, that's the finale to be hoped for.
ATP Top 10: 1. Rafael NADAL (Spain) 9.585 points, 2. Novak DJOKOVIC (Serbia) 8.945 3. Roger FEDERER (Switzerland) 6.190, 4. Danil MEDVEDEV (Russia) 5.705, 5. Dominik TIM (Austria) 5.025, 6 Stefanos Cicipas (Greece) 4,000, 7. Alexander Zverev (Germany) 2,945, 8. Mateo Beretini (Italy) 2,670, 9. Roberto Bautista AGUT (Spain) 2.540, 10. Gael Monfis (France) 2.530.
Serbs in Top 100: 1. ĐOKOVIĆ 9.545, 35. Dušan LAJOVIĆ 1.296, 38. Laslo ĐERE 1.171, 40. Filip KRAJINOVIĆ 1.148, 60. Miomir KECMANOVIĆ 901.
ATP Race: 1. Nadal 9.585, 2. Djokovic 8.945, 3. Federer 6.190, 4. Medvedev 5.705, 5. Team 5.025, 6. Cicipas 4.000, 7. Zverev 2.945, 8. Mateo Beretini (Italy) 2.670 ...
ATP NextGen: 1. Cicipas 3.910, 2. Alex de Minor (Australia) 1.730, 3. Felix Auger Aliassim (Canada) 1.636, 4. Dennis Shapovalov (Canada) 1.495, 5. Frances Tiafo (USA) 1.060, 6. Hugo Imber (France) 932, 7. Casper Rud (Norway) 931, 8. Miomir KECMANOVIC (Serbia) 901 ...

(Photo by Reuters)
